title: Famous Font Usage
content:
Hello all  
could you please suggest some famous font uses for Rockwell & American Typewriter. Its for an article I am writing.  
Thanks!
author: Yolo

comments.content:
Not _famous_ yet, but it’s the typographic web video of the moment:  
 [http://www.motionographermedia.com/jarrattmoody/intonation.mov](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121235/http:/www.motionographermedia.com/jarrattmoody/intonation.mov)

I had a scientific calculator made by Rockwell— and the logo was in Rockwell. The famous book “everything you always wanted to know about sex, but were afraid to ask” tile/logo, I believe, was in American Typewriter.

-M

Find some in the forum search of the Type ID Board:

[American Typewriter](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121235/http:/typophile.com/search?keys=%22american+typewriter%22+tids%3A29)

[Rockwell](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121235/http:/typophile.com/search?keys=rockwell+tids%3A29)
nice one all, thanks for your help. that animation is rather tasty

How could I have forgotten [Milton Glaser’s “I [heart] NY”](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121235/http:/atomiq.org/archives/2006/05/what_is_that_i_ny_typeface.html)? See [this hilarious parody](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121235/http:/typographi.com/001062.php).
